revised_title: Forecasting Plague Epidemics in India through Climate Analysis
tldr: The author investigates the relationship between yearly variations in plague incidence in India and climate, particularly temperature and humidity. They found that high temperatures and low humidity contribute to the decline of rat fleas, which play a significant role in the spread of the plague. The author also discovered that a certain level of dryness, indicated by saturation deficiency, can prevent the continuation of plague epidemics. This research allows for the forecasting of epidemics by monitoring climatic conditions.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Climate and Health
